content.transcript:
All equipment, working surfaces and other utensils in food premises, should be designed and constructed to minimise harbourage of soil, bacteria or pests.

These items must also be easy to clean and disinfect.

Food handlers must keep the work surfaces and equipment clean, being careful to avoid using dirty or defective equipment.

They should report dirty or defective equipment, including leaking sinks and broken taps and never undertake temporary repairs.

They should also make sure all the equipment including washbasins, is used properly.

Report to your supervisor if there is no water or the toilet is blocked.
